Step 2: From features to grid

In order to identify segmental homologies, FISH computes a grid for each pair of contigs. Points in the grid represent matches between pairs of features. The and coordinates of a point are taken to be the positions of the features within their respective contigs. Each position in the grid, whether or not a point is present, is called as a cell.
